alert.note: Alert for Hansford (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 13 at 5:32PM CDT until August 13 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CARSON...HUTCHINSON...SOUTHEASTERN HANSFORD... NORTHERN POTTER...NORTHWESTERN ROBERTS...SOUTHWESTERN OCHILTREE AND SOUTHEASTERN MOORE COUNTIES... At 532 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles east of Pringle to 8 miles northwest of Sanford, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Locations impacted include... Borger, Spearman, Fritch, Stinnett, Sanford, Morse, Four Way, Masterson, Lake Meredith, and Pringle. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
